lead_paragraph: An article on Saturday about Michel Fournier, the retired French army officer with plans to sky dive from a balloon gondola 25 miles above the earth’s surface, misstated the point during his journey at which he expects to experience weightlessness, and it misstated the altitude at which his parachute was designed to open. He would experience weightlessness during descent, not while in the balloon’s gondola. And his parachute is designed to open at around 5,000 feet, not 20,000 feet.
